intro: Icacorea baracoensis, commonly known as the Baracoa coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, specifically found in Cuba. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. Icacorea baracoensis is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
